tool.name: PHAnTASM Data Rescale
tool.description: rescales data to fit in a user specified range
tool.command:
phantasm_data_rescale.py $positional_1
#if $min and $min is not None: --min $min #end if
#if $max and $max is not None: --max $max #end if > $default
tool.help:
PHAnTASM Data Rescaling tool will help the user fix the distribution of data in their tables of values. Given a table
::
#ID, VAL A,-1 B,-2 C,3 D,4
this tool will allow you to rescale that so as to not exceed a specified minimum and maximum
**Changing Scale of Data**
Rescaling data allows you to adapt your data into a format more palatable to downstream analysis. Given a set of negative numbers, it may be desirable to shift these to be positive numbers so a logarithm may be applied. By setting min and max, it is possible to do exactly that. For the above table, if we set min = 1 and max = 10, we would see the following results:
::
A,2.5 B,1 C,8.5 D,10
Very easy!
